intro: Ardisia sarapiquiensis, commonly known as the Sarapiquí ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the humid lowland forests of Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a bright red berry, which is attractive to birds and other wildlife. Ardisia sarapiquiensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to biodiversity and supporting local fauna.
